review: In a nutshell streaming has a lot of bugs to work out no matter which device you use. I purchased chromecast and have been using it just over a month because I was fed up with roku 2. I could not see buying another roku for more of the same so it seemed reasonable to go with chromecast. Roku everyday and several times a day had to be rebooted and that was getting really old. Chromecast started out ok, there is an adjustment to streaming after eons of cable, satellite and remote control. At first chromecast was an improvement over roku not having to reboot several times a day. However that did not last long, just over a month of using the chromecast the sound just decided to no longer function. I would access Hulu through roku and I had sound but when I would switch to chromecast there was no sound. I would access using either my pc, tablet or phone and chromecast would have no sound so it had to be the chromecast device. I uninstalled chromecast, media player etc everything that would make the chromecast work properly and the sound worked again, but temporarily. At this point to watch tv or movies it comes down to either using roku or chromecast, pick your poison, I have to rate them the same, both will stop functioning in their own way and will have to be rebooted. Either device when working like they are supposed too are great but both have a long way to go and many bugs to be fixed.
